intro: Macleania pentaptera var. longicalyx, commonly known as the long-leaf macleania, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, elliptical leaves that are often pubescent. Its flowers are small, clustered in cymes, and typically have four or five petals. This species is valued in horticulture for its ornamental foliage and ability to thrive in shaded, moist environments.
